title: Peering
description: Peering is a voluntary interconnection of administratively separate Internet networks for the purpose of exchanging traffic between the down-stream users of each network.
key-ideas: Data and traffic is exchanged on an equal basis, with neither network more priveleged than the other.
Neither network administrator pays the other for the service; the connection is voluntary and mutual.
Peering is most often associated with a physical connection, likely between routers exchanging routing informatin through Border Gate Protocol (BGP).
